alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued November 30 at 9:23AM EST until November 30 at 9:45AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM EST/845 AM CST/ FOR SOUTHEASTERN JACKSON...DECATUR...GRADY... SOUTHEASTERN MITCHELL...SOUTHWESTERN THOMAS AND SOUTHEASTERN SEMINOLE COUNTIES... At 922 AM EST/822 AM CST/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Ochlocknee to Cairo to 10 miles north of Havana to 9 miles northeast of Greensboro to 10 miles southwest of Chattahoochee to 6 miles north of Blountstown, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Bainbridge, Cairo, Pelham, Camilla, Whigham, West Bainbridge, Chattahoochee, Sneads, Grand Ridge, Attapulgus, Climax, Capel, Cotton, Rocky Hill, Recovery, Harrells Still, Laingkat, Calvary, Jinks and Princes Still. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon EST/1100 AM CST/ for the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
